poem:
**Morning Headlines**

Footsteps in the council halls,  
pacts whispered beneath breath,  
blue and red dance in shadow.  
  
Steady now, calm as the tariff tide,  
a government's murmur blankets dawn.  
  
In the streets, watchful eyes patrol,  
echoes of a nation waiting  
for the next move,  
and the quiet hum  
of power.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Badenoch condones Tories forming pacts with Reform UK if necessary to take control of councils – UK politics live 10.00am BST Yvette Cooper says Trump tariffs U-turn shows why PM has been right to respond to him in calm, 'steady' manner Yvette Cooper, the home secretary, was the government voice on the morning news shows. As Rajeev Syal, Mimi Ibrahim and Vikram Dodd report, she is announcing that police officers on foot will patrol every". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
